item.title: Visual Pleasure and Narrative Cinema
item.description: An essay by [[Laura Mulvey]] which employs psychoanalysis to analyze the ways of the unconscious of patriarchal society how that translates to the big screen

item.title: Avant Garde and Experimental Cinema
item.description: hard to describe, but usually have these elements: small budget, usually financed from filmmaker’s own budget non-linear, non-traditional, usually has no message eccentric, dream like abstract, [[surrealism]], impressionistic

item.title: Comedy in Early Cinema
item.description: 1895 -> mere novelty 1913 -> became an established industry Comedians Keystone Studios

item.title: History of World Cinema
item.description: The Oxford History of World Cinema - Geoffrey Nowell Smith introduction began as a novelty in few big cities - New York, Paris, London, Berlin
